stories.text:
Comments on Hacker News can be very well thought, I'm often impressed with the quality of discussion, although I don't participate much. I'm curious, what do you think was the most insightful comment of 2021?

Prev: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=25604828
stories.title: Ask HN: What was your favorite comment in 2021?

stories.text:
Recently I've been "playing" the introductory CTF at overthewire and ctflearn, and I found that to be a good brushup of my Linux skills.

Soon at my technical uni I'll be having Operating Systems course that's widely considered to be one of the hardest subjects there.

With that in mind, I'd like to start learning about the subject in advance. And there comes the question from the title - do you know anything of that kind?
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there any CTFs/wargames teaching operating systems concept?
Best Apps for Rooted Android Devices
